title: How the rich use insurance to invest in private credit without steep tax bills
summary: Private credit has exploded in popularity among investors, with the market soaring from $1 trillion in 2020 to $1.5 trillion at the beginning of 2024, according to alternative data provider Preqin.
story: Private credit has exploded in popularity among investors, with the market soaring from $1 trillion in 2020 to $1.5 trillion at the beginning of 2024, according to alternative data provider Preqin. The firm expects this figure to reach $2.6 trillion by 2029.

But private credit investing comes with a serious catch. The returns from direct lending are taxed as ordinary income, which has a top federal tax rate of 40.8%, rather than long-term capital gains, for which rates top 23.8%.

This can cost investors millions in returns. For instance, a $5 million investment in private credit could incur $4.3 million in tax drag over 10 years and $61 million over 30 years, according to Bernstein Private Wealth Management.
There are several ways for investors to mitigate their tax liability. The most straightforward is investing through a Roth IRA, but these tax-advantaged accounts are off-limits to high earners.

Instead, high-net-worth investors are increasingly turning to insurance to save on taxes. Instead of investing directly in a private credit fund, they take out insurance policies that invest the premiums in a diversified portfolio of funds.
“You’re getting taxed on the insurance product, rather than being taxed on the underlying private credit investment,” said Yasho Lahiri, funds lawyer and partner at Kramer Levin.
These insurance dedicated funds (IDFs) have multiplied rapidly, according to Lahiri. (The exact number is unclear as many of these funds are unregistered.)

IDFs have to be diversified to meet IRS requirements, which can mean weaker returns than picking one top-performing funds, according to Robert Dietz, national director of tax at Bernstein. However, these funds have other benefits, such as offering better liquidity than private credit funds typically do.

There are two primary options for investing in an IDF. The cheapest route is taking out a private placement variable annuity (PPVA) contract with an insurance carrier. Dietz told CNBC that these annuity policies can make sense for clients with investible assets in the range of $5 million to $10 million.
However, the income taxes associated with that holding are only deferred until the policy owner takes a withdrawal or surrenders the contract.

“At some point someone’s going to have to get hit with that deferred income tax liability,” Dietz said. “That might be the individual who is purchasing the annuity if they decide to take a distribution out in the future, or it could be their beneficiaries when their beneficiaries inherit the annuity.”
The most tax-efficient option is taking out a private placement life insurance (PPLI) policy. Structured correctly, the policy owner’s death benefit is untaxed when it is paid to beneficiaries.

Some clients are turned off by the multimillion-dollar upfront premium and cumbersome underwriting of PPLI policies, but it can be worth it. Dietz said the vehicles can be a good fit for clients with at least $10 million in investible assets.

“If my policy is not structured carefully, my insurance costs can get very expensive, and that can start to eat away at the benefit I’m getting from that cash value accumulating in the policy,” he said.

Since PPLI and PPVAs are unregistered financial products, you must be an accredited investor or qualified purchaser to access them. Accredited investors must earn at least $200,000 annually or have a net worth of more than $1 million, not including a personal residence. For qualified purchasers, the investible asset minimum jumps to $5 million. However, these thresholds have not kept up with inflation or stock market growth, making IDFs more accessible, according to Lahiri.

A powerful tax avoidance tool, PPLI can be used without IDFs and utilized to pass down a wide array of assets, including entire businesses, tax-free. It has caught the attention of Congress, with an investigation by the Senate Committee on Finance describing the PPLI industry as “at least a $40 billion tax shelter used exclusively by only a few thousand wealthy Americans.” Sen. Ron Wyden, D-Ore., then chair of the committee, drafted a proposal in December to curb the tax advantages of PPLI, however that bill is unlikely to pass with a Republican-controlled Congress.

The talk of potential legislation only briefly put clients off PPLI last year, according to Dietz. Client demand for private credit and tax-efficient ways to get a piece of the action is only increasing.

“Family offices and ultra-high-net-worth clients are looking for ways to maximize after-tax returns, and the low-hanging fruit — the long-only equity portfolios and tax-loss harvesting — has already been implemented,” he said. “We’re definitely having more conversations with clients around this.”

title: The powerful message Maria Shriver told herself on a hotel bathroom floor amid divorce
summary: Maria Shriver shares in a poem in her book, "I Am Maria," what she told herself on a hotel bathroom floor amid her divorce from Arnold Schwarzenegger.
story: Maria Shriver still recalls the powerful words she told herself that allowed her to keep going after she learned her husband, Arnold Schwarzenegger, betrayed her by fathering a child outside of their 25-year marriage.
The TODAY contributor writes about the heartbreak of going through a public divorce from the actor and former California governor in her new book of poems, "I Am Maria."

Shriver, 69, wrote in her new book's introduction about a moment after she learned Schwarzenegger had been involved in a sexual relationship with their housekeeper that produced a son, Joseph Baena, now 27.

"As I sat on the hotel room floor in the dark, terrified and alone with tears streaming down my face, I thought to myself: Maria, this doesn't have to be the end of the you. It can't be the end of you. Make it a new beginning of you," she wrote.

Shriver discussed that moment with close friend Oprah Winfrey on the March 25 episode of the “Oprah” podcast, saying, "It’s still an emotional thing for me, but I wanted to pick myself up. I wanted to be more open. I wanted to come out from behind whatever padded door I was living behind.

"I wanted to know how that had happened to me. I wanted to know who I could be moving forward," she continued. "I wanted to show my daughters and my boys that I could hold myself up with my shoulders back, that I could heal."
Shriver told Winfrey she really didn't "know how to heal" at the time, but was determined to do so both for her kids and for herself.

"I had just started going to therapy at the end of my marriage so I had not been someone who had been in therapy," she explained. "I had not been someone who was on the healing path of life. And I went all in."
Shriver, who put her broadcast journalism career on the back burner while Schwarzenegger was in office, recalled that until the couple's painful breakup, she was "playing all the roles" in life.

"I was being a daughter. I was being a journalist. I was being a mother," she said, adding, "It's a lot. Everybody I talk to who's trying to raise kids, take care of parents, work themselves, be a good wife — you're not really thinking about a lot of other things."

Winfrey recalled that in 2011, on the day the story about Schwarzenegger's affair went public in the media, Shriver, who had known about his betrayal for a while by that point, was scheduled to appear at a live taping for the last episode of "The Oprah Winfrey Show."

"I have never seen a friend like you," said Winfrey. "Because on the night that you knew that was going to be going public, you came and you showed up for me ... and I don't know how you did that. You weren't even in your right mind."
Shriver responded, "I wanted to be there for you because you had been there for me," adding that "showing up" for the people she loves is important to her.
Shriver and Schwarzenegger tied the knot in 1986 after several years of dating. Shriver filed for divorce in 2011 and the divorce was finalized in 2021.
The former couple share kids Katherine Schwarzenegger Pratt, 35, Christina Schwarzenegger, 33, Patrick Schwarzenegger, 31, and Christopher Schwarzenegger, 27.
During a May 2023 interview with The Hollywood Reporter, the former governor called his divorce from Shriver “my failure.”
The action star noted it was a coincidence that he played a divorced CIA operative who was unfaithful to his wife in his new Netflix series “Fubar.”
“But in (my real-life marriage to Shriver), it was my f---up. It was my failure,” Schwarzenegger said. “Also, in the show, he’s deep down still in love with his wife.”

Schwarzenegger, who's been dating physical therapist Heather Milligan for more than a decade, added that he still loves Shriver. "She and I are really good friends and very close, and we are very proud of the way we raised our kids," he said.

title: 4 ‘Real Housewives’ under the same roof on a dating show? What could go wrong! See the trailer
summary: Shannon Storms Beador, Gizelle Bryant, Ashley Darby and Luann de Lesseps star in Bravo's trailer for its new dating show, "Bravo's Love Hotel," also on Peacock.
story: Bravo is helping some of the "Real Housewives" find love with its new reality dating series, "Bravo's Love Hotel."

Set to premiere April 27 on Bravo, the show will follow Shannon Storms Beador ("The Real Housewives of Orange County"), Luann de Lesseps ("The Real Housewives of New York City"), and Gizelle Bryant and Ashley Darby ("The Real Housewives of Potomac") as they play the field and try to find their perfect matches.
"I’m going to date multiple people. This isn't some sex hotel, is it?" Shannon teases in a new trailer.

Actor, writer and comedian Joel Kim Booster will play the role of "Love Concierge" and present the ladies with eligible bachelors who are also looking for love. In the trailer, Booster says the Housewives' love lives are "more disaster movie than rom-com" and describes the suitors as ﻿“established,” “successful” and quite well-endowed.
Filmed at the Grand Velas Boutique hotel in Los Cabos, Mexico, the show will feature eight episodes and follow the ladies as they invite suitors into the hotel.
"At 60 years old, I’m going to date multiple men, darn it," Shannon declares in a confessional interview.
From the looks of the trailer, there's plenty of sexual tension on the horizon, especially as Ashley exclaims, "Booty call!" in one scene.
As the ladies search for Mr. Right, they have to compete for the guys' hearts, and it looks like Shannon and Gizelle have their eyes set on the same man.
"I’m going to be honest with you, Shannon," Bryant says in a confessional interview. "Yes, I'm going to take your man."
Things also get a bit tense with some of the guys, as one says, "No one touch Luann because she's my girl."
In the next scene, she says, "No I'm not," seemingly referring to his declaration of affection.
Luann warns one of the male contestants not to touch her friend Cynthia Bailey, known for her time on "The Real Housewives of Atlanta," in one tense moment as Cynthia makes a cameo.
Meanwhile, Shannon gets emotional as she talks about one man, saying, "I heard him screaming at me." In the next scene, Luann consoles her friend, saying, "You're beautiful. You deserve better."
At the end of the show, all four ladies will need to decide if they leave the hotel alone or with one of the suitors.
“Bravo’s Love Hotel” will also stream the following day on Peacock.
(Peacock is part of our parent company, NBCUniversal.)

title: TODAY producers roast Jenna and Barbara Bush for calling each other 'sissy'
summary: TODAY show's fourth hour producers roast co-hosts Jenna Bush Hager and twin sister Barbara Bush over how many times they say "sissy."
story: It's only natural for Jenna Bush Hager and her twin sister, Barbara Pierce Bush, to call each other "sissy."
So natural, in fact, that they did it 17 times in one edition of TODAY with Jenna & Friends.
The TODAY producers brought it to their attention with a clip of all the times the two called each other "sissy" when Barbara served as Jenna's guest co-host on March 24.
"We learned something about ourselves yesterday, and it's that we have a problem," Barbara said on Jenna & Friends on March 25.
"We have a serious problem that we'd like to publicly admit and share with all of you," Jenna said.
"They all know," Barbara replied. "They noticed it. Just we didn't notice it until yesterday."
Jenna hinted that TODAY fans also noticed the overuse.
"Apparently, and thank you all for all of you lovely people that commented, we say 'sissy' —" Jenna said.
"A lot," Barbara said.
"Not just a lot," Jenna said, "like maybe too much. In fact, our producers wanted to show us how much."
The daughters of former President George W. Bush and first lady Laura Bush then watched an edit of all the times they used that affectionate term for one another on the show.
"Turns out we said 'sissy' 17 times just in the chat," Barbara said.
"It's actually amazing that our mouths can do that — that that word could come out 17 times," Jenna said.
The "sissies" are working on it.
"Now I call her Barbara," Jenna said. "We're formal. We've taken 'sissy,' locked it up, put it in my pocket."
Barbara said that Kathy Behrens, her boss at the NBA, where Barbara works in the social responsibility department, said she definitely noticed all the uses of "sissy" between the twins.
"She said no one could say 'sissy' that much, and I said, 'Watch us,'" Barbara joked.
Jenna then tried to explain why the moniker is so common between them.
"You guys, we've only known the world together," she said.
"It started in the womb," Barbara said.
"When we were in the womb I was like, 'Yo, sissy, pass me some of mom's food,'" Jenna said.
They promised to keep the mentions to a minimum on March 25 during Barbara's second day as Jenna's guest co-host.
"We're working on it, and we thank you for your patience," Barbara said.
"We do, and if we say it during the show, we apologize," Jenna said. "We're just being ourselves."
They almost made it through the whole segment without saying it, but had to sneak one in at the end.
"Love us for us," Barbara said.
"Love us for us," Jenna replied. "Sissies first."

title: Ben Affleck breaks silence on his divorce from Jennifer Lopez
summary: Ben Affleck has opened up about his divorce from Jennifer Lopez for the first time in an interview with GQ magazine.
story: Ben Affleck has opened up about his divorce from Jennifer Lopez for the first time.
Affleck spoke about the divorce in an interview with GQ published on March 25, when he was talking about how he presents himself to the public.

"My life is actually pretty drama-free," Affleck said. "And so even if I have the same events that people have — I’m sure in your mind you’re thinking, Oh, well, you just got divorced. That’s not drama-free.

"And I understand that instinct, but all of this is pretty adult, and for all the sensational stuff that gets written, if somebody sat down and talked to me about it, and I said, 'Well, this is really the experience,' their eyes would glaze over with boredom," he continued.

The interviewer said he was thinking about Lopez's documentary "The Greatest Love Story Never Told," in which the premise was about the idea that Lopez and Affleck are private people but have public dimensions, and that Lopez was going to put more of herself and Affleck out there in the documentary.
Affleck's response to the assertion was captured on camera, which the interviewer noted.

"Part of it was, 'Okay, if I’m going to participate in this, I want to try to do it in an honest way and in a way that’s interesting.' Because I thought it was an interesting examination," Affleck told GQ.

"Like I mentioned to you before, there are a lot of people who I think have handled celebrity more adeptly and more adroitly than I have, Jennifer among them," he continued. "My temperament is to be a little bit more reserved and private than hers."
Affleck said that he and his ex-wife didn't always have the same attitude toward fame.

"And so I thought, Oh, this is interesting because how do you reconcile that? Because exactly what you said is true. I love and support this person. I believe in them. They’re great. I want people to see that," he said.
Affleck referenced a line he said in the documentary: "You don’t marry a ship captain and then say, 'Well, I don’t like going out in the water.'"

"You’ve got to own what you knew going into any relationship," he said. "And I think it’s important to say that wasn’t the cause of some major fracture. It’s not like you can watch that documentary and go, 'Oh, now I understand the issues that these two had.'"
Affleck and the interviewer met again a few days later, and Affleck brought up his comments about Lopez again when asked how he felt about the previous conversation.

"Well, on the one hand there’s the first feeling, which is like, well, I hope I was clear about, when you asked me about Jen and the documentary and I talked about that and my sort of personal life a little bit, which I don’t mind doing as long as my actual feelings and intentions and beliefs are communicated, which I hope I was clear that really this is somebody I have a lot of respect for," he said.

"And I get wanting to divine or explore the kind of differences in perspective that we have in terms of how a person feels comfortable approaching the line between public and private life," he continued. "But I really hope that whatever you use doesn’t suggest that I have any negativity or judgment or anything regarding that. I have nothing but respect."
Affleck said there can be a tendency to look at a breakup and want to identify "root causes."
"But honestly, like I said, the truth is much more quotidian than probably people would believe or would be interesting," he said.
The interviewer asked to clarify that there wasn't one major thing that led to their breakup, which Affleck confirmed.

"Yeah, there’s no scandal, no soap opera, no intrigue," he said. "The truth is, when you talk to somebody, 'Hey, what happened?' Well, there is no: 'This is what happened.' It’s just a story about people trying to figure out their lives and relationships in ways that we all sort of normally do.

"And as you get older, this is true for me, I assume it’s true for most people, there is no 'So-and-so did this' or 'This was the big event.' It’s really, it sounds more like a couple’s therapy session, which — you would tune out of someone else’s couple’s therapy after a while," he added. "For one thing, you start going, 'Okay, clearly this person has got these issues. Clearly they have these issues.' And the reason I don’t want to share that is just sort of embarrassing. It feels vulnerable."

Lopez, 55, filed for divorce from Affleck, 52, in August 2024, two years after they married. Lopez cited irreconcilable differences as the reason for their split, according to court documents obtained by TODAY.com.
Lopez addressed the divorce in an October 2024 Interview magazine piece, saying she was “excited” to be single again.
“I’m not looking for anybody,” she noted, saying that the summer of 2024 was a lesson in learning she had to be “good on (her) own.”

Lopez and Affleck first met and got engaged in 2002, but broke up in 2004, before reconnecting in 2021 after multiple engagements and marriages to other people. The pair finalized their divorce in January 2025.

title: What Pedro Pascal had to say about recent pics of him with Jennifer Aniston
summary: Pedro Pascal addressed pictures of him and Jennifer Aniston while they were out to dinner amid dating rumors.
story: Pedro Pascal is commenting on recent photos of him and Jennifer Aniston that made the internet go into a frenzy.

Fans started to speculate a rumored romance between Pascal and Aniston after pictures of the two out at dinner surfaced online. However, Pascal shot down dating rumors during an E! News interview at the Season 2 premiere of "The Last of Us" on March 24.
“We’re friends and we went to dinner with mutual friends,” he shared. "It happens."

Pascal also talked about their outing during an interview with "Access Hollywood." When asked if he was trying to convince Aniston to star in "The Last of Us" at their dinner, he turned the question around, and said he might be interesting in playing a character on Aniston's Apple TV+ series "The Morning Show."
"Would I go on her show?" he said. "That wouldn’t be a terrible thing. I would do anything for Jennifer."
Pascal, who plays Joel Miller in "The Last of Us," said Aniston is a great friend.

“She’s that person. She’s that person to everyone. I think that it’s just that, really. I guess the best way that I could describe it is I remember ... if you’re in a party setting and you make eye contact with Jen, she just knows exactly what’s going on with you and knows exactly how to make you feel," he said.

“If you’re really high at a party, make eye contact with Jen Aniston and she’ll calm your central nervous system,” he laughed. “You’ll be like, ‘Oh no, everything’s fine. I’m safe.’ As soon as your brain just starts to go a little too wild (and) you start to get paranoid, she’ll look at you, get you a glass of water and you’re fine.”
At the 2024 Critics Choice Awards, Pascal, Aniston and Reese Witherspoon joked about what it would be like to have Pascal on "The Morning Show."
In the program, Witherspoon and Aniston play TV anchors who learn how to get along after a big controversy shakes up their news station.
“Do you want to be on it?” Aniston asked Pascal on the red carpet.
“Wait, we actually do have a really good part for him,” Witherspoon said, before Aniston gasped.
“Pitch it to me now,” he replied.
When asked if the role might feature any “romantic” scenes with members of the cast, Aniston joked, “All of us.”
“I sleep with everyone on the show,” he laughed. “I’m in. All right, I’ll be waiting to hear from my agents.”

title: Garcelle Beauvais announces departure from 'Real Housewives' — and the 2 reasons why
summary: Garcelle Beauvais is leaving Bravo's "The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills" after five seasons. See what Andy Cohen told her.
story: Garcelle Beauvais is bidding farewell to "The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills" — for now, at least.
The reality star broke the news in an Instagram video March 25, captioning the post, "CHEERS TO THE NEXT CHAPTER 🙏🏽🥂💕."

“I’ve decided to leave 'Beverly Hills.' It’s been a wild ride. I mean,  some amazing things have happened, and some hard things have also happened. But it’s been a ride, nevertheless," the 58-year-old said.
The mother of three went on to explain what motivated her decision to step away from the Bravo reality series after five seasons.

"One of the reasons why I'm leaving is my family, my boys. Their last year of high school is next year, and I want to be a part of that. And Jaid is starting a new career, and I want to be a part of that, too," she said.
Beauvais has three sons: 17-year-old twins named Jaid and Jax and a 34-year-old named Oliver.

Beauvais will no longer be appearing on "The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills," but she does still have a packed schedule, as she explained while describing the second reason she's moving on from the show.
"And secondly, I have the most exciting projects that I am developing, producing and acting in. I can't tell you anything right now, but you'll know soon," she teased.
Beauvais went on to express her gratitude to the show's cast, crew and producers, including Andy Cohen.
"Andy Cohen says I can come back anytime. The door will always be open. So you never know, I might pop back in sometime," she said.
Cohen commented on Beauvais' post, writing, "an incredible run from an incredible human."
Heather Dubrow, a star of "The Real Housewives of Orange County," also weighed in on the news, commenting, “Love you Garcelle! Beautiful inside and out and I’m excited for your next chapter !”
"RHOBH" star Jennifer Tilly wrote: "Oh my God! Garcelle, We will really miss you! 🥺 You brought so much integrity and warmth and humor to the franchise."
Beauvais ended her video by speaking directly to the show's viewers.

"To the fans, I want to say thank you so much. You guys have cheered me on, supported me and sometimes even fought for me or on my behalf. It means a lot, and I hope you guys will continue on this journey with me. It's not goodbye. It's see you later. So see you later," she said.

In 2023, Beauvais stopped by Studio 1A to discuss her time on "The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills" with Jenna Bush Hager and Hoda Kotb. During the interview, she spoke about the challenges of navigating life on reality TV and maintaining privacy for her sons.

"That's what's really tough, finding the balance between all of it. But you know, with (my sons) they're happy to do it, and then towards the end of the season, they don't want any cameras. They just want to do their own thing," she said. "And, you know, that's kind of tough because I signed up for it. They didn't. But they go along, and then when I feel like they've had enough, I tell the producers."

title: See Robert De Niro’s reaction to surprise ‘taxi’ message from Ms. Rachel for his daughter
summary: Drew Barrymore surprised Robert De Niro with a special message that YouTuber Ms. Rachel had made for his daughter Gia.
story: Robert De Niro has something special to show his 1-year-old daughter, Gia.

On the March 25 episode of "The Drew Barrymore Show," Barrymore surprised the actor with a clip that famous YouTuber Ms. Rachel had made for Gia, after Barrymore learned that De Niro likes to watch the children's show with his kid.
“Is it true that Ms. Rachel is alive and well in your home?” Barrymore asked the “Raging Bull” star, who responded "yes."

"I became aware of Ms. Rachel, and I realized that also, Ms. Rachel — if there's a problem with the baby and there's a lot of unhappiness, put on Ms. Rachel," he laughed. "It just immediately goes away."
Barrymore then surprised De Niro by showing him a clip that Ms. Rachel, whose full name is Rachel Griffin-Accurso, had made for Gia, who turns 2 in April.
In the clip, the YouTuber referenced De Niro's popular film "Taxi Driver" when she gave Gia a quick lesson about cabs.
“Hi, Gia! It’s Ms. Rachel. What’s that?" she said while holding a toy taxi in her hand. "It's a taxi! What does a taxi say? ‘Beep beep, beep beep.’

"What does a taxi driver say? ‘Are you talking to me?’” she added while imitating De Niro from his film. “Yay, great job! You have such a special bond with your dada, and your dada and your mama love you so much. You bring them so much joy. Bye, Gia.”
After the video, De Niro told Barrymore that he would love to show Ms. Rachel's message to Gia.
"It's great," he said of the clip.
"So you think she'll like that?" Barrymore asked.
"It's nice to show it to her. I don't know what her reaction will be," he responded.
De Niro shares Gia with his girlfriend, Tiffany Chen, and he's also a father to six other kids from previous relationships.
During a recent appearance on SiriusXM's Radio Andy, De Niro revealed that Gia also likes to watch “The Wiggles” and “Blippi" in addition to Ms. Rachel.

title: Barbara Bush says she and Jenna 'hazed' now-husband Craig Coyne on their first date
summary: When Barbara Pierce Bush first met her future husband, Craig Coyne, she had some help from her lifelong partner in crime — her twin sister, Jenna Bush Hager.
story: When Barbara Pierce Bush first met her future husband, Craig Coyne, she had some help from her lifelong partner in crime — her twin sister, Jenna Bush Hager.

“My first date with Craig was a blind date. Jenna was on it,” Barbara said in People’s latest cover story featuring her and her sister. “I had told Jenna before, ‘I don’t know this guy. Under no circumstances invite him along.’ And within five minutes she said, ‘What are you doing tonight? Do you want to come to our book event?’”
“So he came, and we hazed him,” she continued. “We never thought we’d see him again! Now we’re married.”
Barbara has shared other details in the past about her first encounter with her husband-to-be.

“(The date) was so blind that I didn’t know what he looked like,” she told People in 2018. “And so I went up to two guys before him in the lobby, asking if they were him. And then, luckily, a really handsome guy walked in, and I thought, ‘Please, maybe this one will be him.’ And it was him. And so that was our first date, and he rolled with it.”
The former first daughter and Coyne, an actor and screenwriter, tied the knot on Oct. 7, 2018. They wed in an intimate ceremony in Kennebunkport, Maine, at the Bush family’s Walker's Point compound.
“Don’t let him tell you he didn’t know what he was getting into, because he did!” Jenna teased her sister in their recent People interview.
Barbara and Jenna’s close bond was on full display as they co-hosted TODAY with Jenna & Friends on Monday and Tuesday.
“You’re a mom of two!” Jenna exclaimed to her twin on the show March 24. “Since the last time you were here, you had a baby boy.”
Barbara and her husband welcomed a son, Edward Finn, in August. They are also parents to daughter Cora Georgia, 3.
“I have a new little guy named Edward,” Barbara said on TODAY, sharing an adorable photo of her family. “There they are, Edward and Cora Georgia — my little cuties.”
Barbara noted that her son is “a big guy,” weighing in at 30 pounds.
“Wow,” Jenna said.
“To put it in context, my 3-year-old is 32 pounds, so he is large and in charge,” Barbara joked.
It’s been all about family this week for the twins, who sat down with their mom, Laura Bush, for a heartwarming interview about parenting.

“It’s wonderful to have grandchildren, I’m thrilled to have grandchildren,” Laura Bush told her daughters. “For one thing, we can be with them, we can play with them, then we can send them all to y’all!”
Jenna and Barbara also read their mom passages from their new picture book, “I Loved You First,” which honors the bond between parents and children.
“Daddy and I did love you first,” the former first lady said, growing emotional.

title: Jenna Fischer doesn't have the teapot from ‘The Office’ – but reveals who does
summary: Jenna Fischer and John Krasinski talk to the Los Angeles Times about the teapot from “The Office" and their favorite memories as the show celebrates 20 years.
story: Jenna Fischer is spilling the tea(pot) about one of the most memorable props from “The Office.”

Fischer, who played secretary Pam Beesly on the popular comedy, says co-star John Krasinski, who played Pam's love interest, Jim Halpert, has the teapot his character gave to hers during a Secret Santa gift exchange in a Season Two Christmas episode.
“John got the teapot! How does that make sense?” Fischer told the Los Angeles Times.

“She ratted me out! Yes, I have the teapot, which I realize is quite the memento,” Krasinski told the newspaper in an email. “It actually came to me by happenstance as our incredible prop master Phil Shea sent me a box of props some time after we had wrapped.”

It’s been 20 years since “The Office” premiered, with the pilot airing March 24, 2005. It ran for nine seasons before signing off in 2013, with the love story between Jim and Pam one of the show’s central plotlines over the years.

In the episode with the teapot, Jim gives it to Pam, filling it with mementoes of inside jokes between them, as well as a note he wrote for her. The Secret Santa goes sideways, though, when Steve Carell's Michael Scott turns it into a Yankee Swap, enabling others to steal presents. Pam eventually gets the teapot back, but Jim removes the note. Pam would later find out about the note and read it during an episode of “The Office’s” ninth and final season.
Fischer had previously said she wouldn’t reveal what was actually in the note.

“In that episode in season nine, I believe (‘The Office’ writer and producer) Greg (Daniels) suggested to John that he write a personal message from himself to me just saying what our time together on ‘The Office’ meant to him,” Fischer said while choking up during a 2020 episode of her podcast, “Office Ladies,” that she hosts with co-star Angela Kinsey. “We were wrapping up the series, and we were all so emotional at that time.”
“And so, that was his goodbye,” she added.
While Krasinski may have wound up with the teapot, Fischer didn’t leave the show empty-handed. She said she still has her Dundie Awards trophies, among other things.

“I have both (Dundies), for Longest Engagement and Whitest Sneakers. I kept a bunch of stuff,” she told the Los Angeles Times. “I kept one of Pam’s sweaters and one of her shirts. I kept her watch, her purse, and I kept the necklace that she wore for Jim and Pam’s wedding.”
Fischer calls the items she kept “little treasures,” noting she also has the yogurt lid that doubled as a medal during the impromptu Olympics the office held, as well as some more minor items.
“I kept this pen that was on her desk. It doesn’t even work, but I kept it,” she said before mentioning another item fans may not remember.

“This cup was Pam’s cup on the show, and in the ninth season, it fell off the desk and broke. But the crew knew that I had wanted to take it, and so they glued it back together for me. I can’t use it, but I have it,” she said.
Krasinski also got a big haul, thanks to Shea.

“(Phil sent) things he thought I’d like to have, and it was a veritable treasure chest with my bag from the show, my name plate from my desk, even the copy of ‘The Adventures of Jimmy Halpert’ comic book,’” Krasinski added.
“The Office” continues to live on today, even among the cast.
“We have an ‘Office’ text thread. We get emails from Greg Daniels, and it’s a really special community of people, and we will be bonded for life,” Fischer said.
“I think we’re all blown away by its staying power,” Krasinski said about the show.

title: Trisha Yearwood dedicates part of Walk of Fame speech to ‘cheerleader’ husband Garth Brooks
summary: Trisha Yearwood thanked husband Garth Brooks during her speech when she got a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.
story: Trisha Yearwood made sure to thank someone near and dear to her heart when she was honored with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame on March 24.
Yearwood noted early in her speech that there are “a lot of Garths in my life” before singling out her husband, fellow country star Garth Brooks.

“The first Garth that I met is here, and the one that has really been a cheerleader and, who, as many accolades and awards as he has won, I never see him get more excited than he does when I receive something,” she said. “And for all the people that want this for me, nobody wants it more than you. And I just appreciate you for being my support.”
The "Walkaway Joe" singer then joked about where her star is in relation to Brooks’.
“We’re down a few stars from each other, but we’re going to figure out something. We’ll put some breadcrumbs or something,” she said.
“He’s my person. He’s the love of my life,” Yearwood told “Extra” at the ceremony, which also featured speeches from Carly Pearce and Reba McEntire.

“He’s accomplished so much in his career, but he really is happiest when other people win, and I think he just believes in me so much and he believes that I deserve more than I believe I deserve. And so I genuinely believe he’s the happiest person here today.”
Brooks previously gushed about his wife after she received the ACM Honors Icon Award during the ACM Honors last August.

“I was just so proud,” he wrote on his website at the time. “I’m always proud of her, but to see and hear her recognized like that — and to hear people use the word ‘icon’ in the same breath as her name — just took me someplace new.
“She is an icon. I know what a world-class talent and force she is…and we all know what an incredible vocalist she is…but I love it when others really take notice, too.”

Yearwood and Brooks, who married in 2005, performed together at last week's "Opry 100," which celebrated the 100th anniversary of the Grand Ole Opry. The couple also teamed up at the funeral for former President Jimmy Carter in January. The pair sang John Lennon’s “Imagine,” which they also performed at the 2023 funeral for Carter’s late wife, Rosalynn Carter.
Last October, Brooks was sued by a plaintiff identified as “Jane Roe,” who alleged the “Friends in Low Places” singer sexually assaulted and battered his former hair and makeup artist.
“A lot’s happened in the last two weeks. Let’s address the elephant in the room, shall we?” Brooks said during “Inside Studio G” fan chat on TalkShopLive on Oct. 7.
“This thing is on, it’s going to happen, and people are telling me, it could be up to two years. OK?” he continued.

“So, my suggestion is, well, take a deep breath, we all just kind of settle in and let’s hold hands and take the trip together, because it is something that you cannot talk about. That’s all we can say about it.”

title: ‘The Conners’ returns for its 7th and final season. What to know before it returns
summary: ABC announced their hit sitcom, “The Conners,” is saying farewell with its seventh season. Here's what to know ahead of its final season.
story: After six seasons on air, ABC announced their hit sitcom, “The Conners,” is saying farewell with its seventh season.
Set to debut on March 26, the final season premiere comes 10 months after Season 6 wrapped up in May 2024.

The "Roseanne" spinoff premiered in 2018 and featured its namesake, Roseanne Barr, alongside her co-stars from the original series. Later that year, ABC canceled the revival after Barr published racist posts on X, formerly known as Twitter.
The network later rebranded the show as "The Conners" and continued with the sitcom without Barr, whose character they killed off with an accidental opioid overdose.
As viewers prepare for the final season of "The Conners," we're taking a look back at all the highlights from the Season 6 finale.
Mark gets a dangerous job to save money for school
Darlene's (Sara Gilbert) son Mark (Ames McNamara) has been working multiple jobs to save money for his tuition at the University of Chicago since the school will only hold his spot for a year.
When he gets a gig with a company that repossesses cars, Mark asks his grandfather Dan (John Goodman) to teach him how to drive a truck.

Dan cautions Mark that this line of work can be pretty dangerous, but Jackie (Laurie Metcalf) suggests that they might've hired Mark to be a decoy. Mark proceeds to tell them that he got the job because of his computer skills and explains that a car's computer system needs to be cleared of personal data when it's repossessed.

Dan and Jackie agree to go to work with Mark and they all get nervous when they run into the owner of a car Mark is repossessing. The group sympathizes with the woman, who has a young child, and lets her keep the car.
"No amount of money is worth this. We're not taking her car," Mark says.
Dan warns the woman that she might want to park a few blocks away from her house to avoid the next company that tries to repossess her car.

Dan gives a pep talk to a discouraged Mark and when they return home, they begrudgingly tell Darlene where they've been. She tells Mark she'd rather work more than have him put his life at risk and Dan and Jackie both say they're willing to get jobs to help Mark.

Mark is touched but frustrated since he doesn't want to be a burden to his family. He visits a classmate who says he can make him money hacking computers. The job pays well and is safer than repossessing cars, so Mark takes it then tells Darlene he's working for a Fortune 500 company so she won't worry. Dan says he still wants to get a job since he's bored.
Harris and Becky want to move out of Darlene's house
While playing a game of cards with her family, Darlene admits that she's been facing some financial challenges.
"The raise is to you, Becky, and it is $200," she says, talking to her sister.
"What? The whole pot is 40 cents and a half-eaten candy cane," Becky (Lecy Goranson) replies.
"I've got to get some more money to pay the bills somehow. You know, like gas, water, electric, groceries, everything is up," Darlene explains.
"I'll see your 200 and raise you a million, gazillion dollars," Becky says sarcastically.
"Ok fine, then it's $200 to you Harris," Darlene says to her daughter. "You live with me too so it's only fair."
Harris (Emma Kenney) then drops some big news on the family and says, "I think I can help with costs. I'm moving out."
Becky shocks her sister by saying, "Wow, bombshell. Also, me too."

Harris explains that she's making more money at her job and wants to have her own space so she applied to rent a one bedroom apartment. Later in the episode, Harris learns that she can't get the apartment without a co-signor. Darlene is hesitant to help, especially since she needs to help Mark with his school tuition.
Harris grows jealous that her mother is helping her brother and not her. But later in the episode, Darlene does decide to co-sign for her daughter.

Meanwhile, Becky wants to take the next steps with her boyfriend Tyler (Sean Astin), who currently lives with his mother. Darlene is concerned that her sister is moving too quickly and repeating old relationship mistakes. Darlene also cautions her sister that moving in with her boyfriend could negatively affect Becky's daughter.

Later in the episode, Dan has a pep talk with Darlene, who admits that she felt like she needed to take care of her family when her mother, Roseanne, died. Now, she feels like she needs them and is upset that they're leaving her.
Darlene finally comes to terms with Becky's move and tells her she's ok with her leaving. Becky then surprises her by suggesting that her boyfriend move in with them since Harris is moving out.
"I think it'd be good for us to have kind of a test run on living together," she says.

title: Are ‘The Bachelor’s’ Grant Ellis and Juliana Pasquarosa still together now?
summary: Are Grant and Juliana from "The Bachelor" still together now? Read what they've revealed about their relationship since "The Bachelor" Season 29 ended.
story: The first part of “The Bachelor” Season 29 finale ended with Grant Ellis professing his love and proposing to the final woman standing. The “After the Final Rose” special that quickly followed revealed if the two are still together today.

During the three-hour live finale, which aired Monday, March 24, Grant’s parents, Renee and Robert, and sister, Taylor, met his final two: Litia Garr, a 31-year-old venture capitalist from Salt Lake City, Utah, and Juliana Pasquarosa, a 28-year-old client service associate from Newton, Massachusetts.

Although both ladies impressed Grant’s family, his mother seemed to favor Litia. “I would be very happy with Litia. She’d make a great daughter-in-law,” Renee gushed in her confessional interview. But, she told her son to prioritize his happiness and to not let her opinion impact him.
After getting to know Juliana, Renee was more cautious when speaking to Grant. She said she asked Juliana some tough questions and she wasn’t “quite there yet.”
“If she doesn’t tell you she loves you, I’m asking you to walk away from that,” Renee pleaded with her son.

Grant, a 31-year-old day trader from Newark, New Jersey, then sat down with his father, explaining to him that he wants someone who makes him feel comfortable. Robert shared some emotional advice with his son.
“In spite of my madness, you’re still my son, you still love me,” Robert said. “I love the man that you have become.”

After the second family visit, Grant told Juliana he loved her. She replied, “For so long I’ve debated on what it would mean to actually know that I love you. I think I’m finally realizing after meeting your family it’s not one particular moment. I think I’ve known that I love you, too,” she added.

Despite getting advice from his family, Grant remained conflicted. He had already told Litia in the penultimate episode that he was in love with her, but he expressed his strong feelings for Juliana, as well.
Grant had romantic final dates in the Dominican Republic with both women, hoping it would bring him clarity. But on the day of the final rose ceremony, he awoke still unsure who to choose.
“For me to not know what I’m going to do is tearing me up inside. Both of these women are equally amazing and I’m so close to both of them,” he said in a confessional interview.
His father arrived to offer support. Robert reminded him that he deserves to be happy and he should trust himself because his future is “bright.”
Still, Grant struggled to tell host Jesse Palmer which woman to send first. Following a “Bachelor” tradition, the first contestant who arrives to meet the lead is the person who will be eliminated.
“I don’t know,” he said when Palmer asked how he would say goodbye to a woman he loved.
After a delay, Grant finally informed Palmer and producers who he wanted to see first. He explained to the cameras that he was following his heart.

Litia arrived and took a deep breath as she stepped out of the car. But, she immediately smiled when she saw Grant. She told him she was nervous before speaking. “I started falling for you on Week 2 but I didn’t tell you because I don’t like to express it,” she said. “On our one-on-one in Scotland, I knew that I loved you.”
She added that she wanted to give him a family and a happy home filled with children.
“I love you so much and I feel so lucky to be loved by you. You just have shown me how I want to be loved, forever,” she shared.

He told her he was looking for an emotional connection and he found it with her. “You are one of the most amazing, beautiful women that I’ve ever met. You deserve love and you deserve to be treated right … This is hard for me.”
“I’m not your person,” he continued after saying he loved her. He apologized and said he had a stronger emotional connection with someone else.

She asked when everything changed, and he insisted that it hadn’t. She said she viewed him differently as the live audience applauded her. Litia said she got the answers she was looking for and he wasn’t who she thought he was.

Litia said Juliana was beautiful and she expected her to have a lot of questions. As he walked her out, she said the “switch up” from Grant makes this situation more “devastating.” After some push back, he took responsibility for hurting her.
“I just want to be so clear that I’m confused and I’m sad. And I’m mad,” she told him before departing.
Did Grant and Juliana get engaged?
After the tearful breakup, Juliana met Grant and reflected on their journey together.
“Grant, not too long ago, there was a part of me that believed I may not be deserving of true love,” she began. “But today, I stand in front of a man who gave me a reason to fight those beliefs.”

She recalled them laughing about her basketball skills on an early group date and falling for him in Scotland. Juliana said she felt like a woman deserving of his love. She promised to create a “safe space” for him on his tough days.
“I just want you to know that I love you and you’d make me the luckiest girl in the world if I could spend the rest of my life with you,” she added.
He replied, “Through this whole journey, you have been someone that has inspired me. You keep me laughing with your contagious smile.”
Grant called her his best friend and said he will be there for her in all her darkest moments as “her man, her friend and her partner.”

He then lowered to one knee and asked Juliana to marry him. She swiftly responded, “Yes! A million times yes!” They shared multiple kisses and repeated how much they loved each other. He also asked her to accept his final rose.
“Always and forever,” they agreed.
Are Grant and Juliana still together?

During the “After the Final Rose” segment of the finale, Grant and Juliana updated Palmer on what has happened since the day they got engaged. She walked out and greeted Grant with a kiss, marking their first public appearance as a couple, as the audience crowd cheered.

Juliana squealed as she showed off her ring to the camera. “This moment just feels so surreal. This whole journey has felt like a fever dream,” she told Palmer. Juliana also shared that they have built a deeper connection over the last few months.
Grant chimed in and said he chose Julianna for her “outlook on life, her demeanor and her character.” He said they developed a solid foundation for both a friendship and a relationship.
As for Grant struggling until the last minute to make a choice? Juliana didn’t seem too bothered. She said she gave Grant “grace” and she is confident in who she is and what they have.
Next up, Grant and Juliana are moving to Boston together. But before they relocate, the show announced they are sending the happy couple to Italy.

title: ‘Bachelor’ finale recap: Who does Grant Ellis pick as his winner?
summary: Who does Grant Ellis choose as his winner in Season 29 of The Bachelor? Did he propose to Litia Garr or Juliana Pasquarosa? Find out spoilers.
story: Grant Ellis had a difficult choice before him at the start of the Season 29 finale of "The Bachelor."
He said he loved Litia Garr in the previous episode — but it was clear his feelings for Juliana Pasquarosa were equally deep.
Here's what happened in the Season 29 finale of "The Bachelor," starting with visits with Grant's family and ending with a romantic proposal.
What happened when Juliana and Litia met Grant's family?

Litia and Juliana each met with Grant's mother, father and sister. Grant's parents are divorced but came together for the show.  "To have an opinion from the people I love the most is important," Grant said.
The visit with Litia went well — she quickly won over Grant's mother, Renee. “I see the joy that he has with her,” she said in a confessional.
His sister, who met Litia in Episode 1 at the Bachelor Mansion, also was happy. "I liked you since Day 1," she told Litia.
After the visit, Renee was swayed. She thought Litia understood and saw her son and said the experience was a "joy " for her.
“She’s genuine. She loves Grant. You can see it. I would be very happy with Litia. She’d make a great daughter-in-law," she said.

Onto Juliana! While Renee liked Juliana, she was concerned that Juliana hadn't said that she loved Grant yet. "If she doesn't tell you she loves you, I am asking you to walk away from that," she said.

But she didn't have to worry for too long. After saying their goodbyes, Grant took Juliana outside and told her that he loved her. She replied, "For so long, I've debated on what it would mean to actually know that I love you. I think I'm finally realizing after meeting your family it’s not one particular moment."
Juliana then reciprocated his feelings and said she loved him, too.
So, who does Grant propose to?
“In all of 'Bachelor' history it has never come down to the wire like this,” host Jesse Palmer said in the lead-up to the proposals.
By the time of the last dates, Grant said he was fully in love with both Juliana and Litia — something he didn't know was possible.
Going into the "biggest decision" of his life "thus far," Grant spent one-on-one time with each of his remaining ladies. Unfortunately, since both dates went well, Grant was even more confused.
"I feel alone. I have to make a decision. And make a decision pretty fast. I don't know," Grant said alone in the hotel room.
Enter: His dad to help him choose. "They're both amazing women," Grant told his dad. He said he felt paralyzed. "What if it doesn't work out? "There's risk on both sides," he said.
Grant picked out the rings and then the final part of his journey began. He left the car in the pouring rain for what might be a first in "Bachelor" history: A rainy proposal.
Jesse asked Grant which of the women "to send out first," suggesting he was deciding until the last minute.

Litia was the first to emerge from the limo. Wearing a golden dress, Litia said she was "ready to get engaged." People in the audience looked devastated as they saw what was coming. Grant and Litia shared two kisses before he began his preamble.

"Litia, I love you very much and I want to give you everything you deserve. But I'm not your person," he said. Litia seemed to physically recoil. "My emotional connection is stronger somewhere else," he said.

"When did it change?" Litia asked, looking doubtful. She stood up to Grant when he said he hoped she wouldn't view him differently. "You're different than I thought," she concluded — but then said Juliana should have "questions" based on everything he told her.
"Come on," she continued to say. "The things that you kept saying along the way make this decision all the more devastating. The switch-up is crazy."
Grant said he would "take responsibility" for it. "I'm not perfect. I'm trying to do my best. I'm truly sorry," he said.
Litia held her ground until the very end. "I believe that. I want to be so clear. I'm confused and I'm sad. And I'm mad," she said.

During the "After the Final Rose" special, Litia reiterated how shocked she was given Grant's promises. "I remember saying goodbye to him and saying, 'Oh my gosh, we're getting engaged tomorrow.' And him saying, 'I know. I can't wait. I love you, I love you, I love you,'" she said.
She said Grant had told her she was his "number one emotional connection."
Litia confronted him again at "After the Final Rose," saying he led her on.
"As a man I have to accept responsibility for my actions," he said.
Litia got a rousing applause from the audience by the end of the exchange.
Grant beamed when Juliana walked his way wearing a salmon, sparkling dress. He continued to smile through her promises to him.
Juliana told Grant she loved him. "I'll be there for you as your man, as your friend and as your partner," Grant said, dropping to one knee.
He proposed with an emerald cut ring and she exclaimed, "Yes!"
As of the "After the Final Rose" special, Grant and Juliana are still together.
'The whole journey has felt like a bit of a fever dream. We've lived so many months reconnecting. I'm so excited to have dinner with this man," she said.

title: When and what time is Grant Ellis’ ‘The Bachelor’ finale?
summary: Who will Grant Ellis propose to in the upcoming three-hour season finale of “The Bachelor?” Find out how to tune into the dramatic conclusion.
story: Who will Grant Ellis propose to in the upcoming three-hour season finale of “The Bachelor?” Well, based on the previews, he will be torn about the decision up until the moment he kneels on one knee.
All season long, “The Bachelor” has shown glimpses of an “incredibly emotional” ending, as host Jesse Palmer says in the teaser, to Grant’s journey to find love.
Grant, a 31-year-old day trader from Newark, New Jersey, developed strong feelings for his remaining two women, Litia Garr and Juliana Pasquarosa, over the last few episodes.

Leading into the finale, which was filmed in the Dominican Republic, Grant told Litia he was in love with her, suggesting she might receive his final rose. But, he has also repeatedly expressed that he could see Juliana as his wife.

“Juliana makes me feel special and I see her as the mother of my children,” he says in the preview. “Litia is a picture of what I came in here looking for. She makes me feel like there’s a future in her. And I can’t wait to see what the future holds.”

In the live finale, Bachelor Nation will watch Grant introduce both ladies to his parents and older sister as he tries to figure out which woman is his soulmate. Want to make sure you don’t miss the conclusion to Grant’s season? Find out how to tune in, below.
When is Grant’s finale of ‘The Bachelor?’
The three-hour live finale of Grant’s season of “The Bachelor” will air on Monday, March 24.
What time is ‘The Bachelor’ finale?

How to watch the finale

title: Amy Schumer opens up about taking Mounjaro: 'Wanted to keep it real with you'
summary: Amy Schumer shared her positive experience being on Mounjaro, a prescription drug that's approved to treat Type 2 diabetes and also commonly prescribed for weight loss.
story: Amy Schumer is sharing her experience taking Mounjaro — a prescription drug that's approved to treat Type 2 diabetes and also commonly prescribed for weight loss — after being vocal about the side effects she experienced on other similar medications.

In a March 21 Instagram video, the 43-year-old actor and comedian described having a "really good experience" on Mounjaro after previously not being able to "handle" the side effects of Wegovy, a popular weight loss drug.

“I wanted to share, and keep it 100 with you, that years ago — and yes, this is completely unsafe to be driving and making a video — years ago, three years ago, I tried Wegovy and I was like puking,” Schumer said.
“I couldn’t handle it. I don’t know if they’ve changed the formula or whatever," she added.

After her unsuccessful experience with Wegovy, the "Kinda Pregnant" star arranged a telehealth meeting with Midi Health, a virtual care clinic specializing in perimenopause and menopause. (Schumer later disclosed that she ended up investing in the company after the appointment.)

“They put me on estrogen and progesterone because I realized I was in perimenopause and my symptoms of being in perimenopause have disappeared,” she said, adding that she also has been taking Mounjaro.
"My hair is fuller, my skin is better, I have more energy. I want to 'get down' more, if you know what I mean,” said Schumer, adding, “I’m talking about sex.”
“I’m having a really good experience, so I wanted to keep it real with you about that,” said Schumer.

Many have turned to telehealth sites to obtain a prescription for drugs that can help with weight loss. Anyone seeking a prescription for a weight loss drug online should first speak with a trusted health care provider.
Schumer's health update comes more than a year after she described the side effects she experienced on Ozempic during a June 2023 episode of "Watch What Happens Live with Andy Cohen."
“I was one of the people that felt like sick, I couldn’t like play with my son,” she said, noting that the drug succeeded in making her "so skinny."
“You’re like, ‘OK this isn’t livable for me,’ but I immediately invested because I’m like, ‘Everyone and their mom is going to try it,’” she added.

title: Drake Bell and Josh Peck break silence on relationship, 'Quiet on Set' in emotional reunion
summary: Drake Bell and Josh Peck reunited for an emotional conversation covering Quiet on Set, their friendship now and Nickelodeon.
story: Nearly 20 years after the end of the Nickelodeon series “Drake & Josh,” former co-stars Drake Bell and Josh Peck reunited for a two-part of episode Peck’s “Good Guys“ podcast. In it, they discussed their relationship and the fallout from the documentary series “Quiet on Set: The Dark Side of Kids TV.”

In “Quiet on Set,” which aired on ID in April 2024, Bell came forward as the unnamed minor in the 2004 sexual abuse case against former acting and dialogue coach Brian Peck (no relation to Josh Peck).
Brian Peck pleaded no contest to two charges of sexual abuse in October 2004 and was found guilty of both. He spent 16 months in prison and was made to register as a sex offender.
During the first episode of the podcast, released March 24, Bell situated the abuse case within his relationship with Josh Peck and his larger Nickelodeon career.
Bell said he told his mom about Brian Peck’s abuse, kicking off the investigation, between the end of “The Amanda Show” in 2002 and the premiere of “Drake & Josh” in 2004.
The pending investigation with Brian Peck impacted Bell’s ability to be present on the set of “Drake & Josh,” he said. In the show, Bell and Josh Peck play stepbrothers and polar opposites.

“The whole time I’m working with doing the pilot I know that there’s an investigation happening. I know that this guy’s (Brian Peck) about to get arrested. I know that s–t is about to hit the fan, and nobody in here knows it,” Bell said.
Meanwhile, Josh Peck said he perceived Bell’s behavior as distance — that is, until he saw the recent documentary.

“I was just looking at it through the prism of a 14-year-old’s brain like, ‘He doesn’t want much to do with me,’” Josh Peck explained. “In watching the documentary at 38, as a father, as a grown-up, so much was revealed to me of what you had to go through. I can’t even imagine that.”

Bell, at the time, was afraid the investigation would go public and impact “Drake & Josh.” While filming, Bell said he lost his hair and got scabs on his head, which Bell’s doctor attributed to stress.
“It was ever present,” Bell told Peck about the investigations when filming “The Amanda Show.”
Bell also discussed his worries about how the investigations would affect “Drake & Josh.”
“I’m doing the thing that I’ve always wanted to do, and I’ve got my partner to do it with,” Bell disclosed. “When this drops, is Josh (Peck) going to look at me like, ‘Bro, you took our dream away.’”
Despite his fears, Bell’s identity wasn’t revealed until he came forward in 2024.
“Drake & Josh” ended in 2007. The two co-stars made public reunions, like at Nickelodeon events and in Josh Peck’s show “Grandfathered.”

They had a fallout in 2017, however, when Josh Peck did not invite Bell to his wedding, and Bell fired off a series of since-deleted tweets. According to E! News at the time, Bell wrote, “When you’re not invited to the wedding the message is clear.”
Josh Peck said in a 2022 “BFFs“ podcast episode that he didn’t invite Bell to his wedding “because I hadn’t really talked to him in many, many years.”

“Cut to: I’m getting married that night and I see these text messages from him cursing me out, coming for me on the night of my wedding. And I’m like, ‘Yo.’ And it’s delusional because I’m like, ‘Bro, we worked at Coffee Bean when we were 16. I’m sorry, I’m 31 now. I might’ve lost your number,’” he continued.
At the time, Josh Peck made it seem like he and Bell were not on good terms.

“‘Drake & Josh’ is something I’ll be synonymous with forever and I’m proud of it,” he said. “And I want to like the guy that my name is attached to forever, but unfortunately, it just sort of worked out the way that it did.”
He also asked Bell to apologize to his wife at the MTV Video Music Awards after the wedding.

Bell reacted to Josh Peck’s comments in an interview with “Hollywood Raw” in 2023, saying that he “never texted him, cursing him out the night of his wedding because I didn’t know that there was a wedding until he posted about it the next day.”
The two don’t address the wedding in the first part of the podcast. However, they speak about “Drake & Josh’s” legacy.
Bell said when supporters say they’ll never watch “Drake & Josh” again, he tells them to do otherwise.
“That was actually where I was comfortable and happy and stoked, and I’m very proud of what we did,” Bell said to Josh Peck while tearing up.
“It was very special and you can’t recreate it,” Josh Peck replied.
The second part of the conversation drops March 27.

title: Wilson Phillips sings 'Hold On' with Carnie Wilson’s daughter during her ‘American Idol’ audition
summary: Two-thirds of Wilson Phillips helped out when Carnie Wilson's daughter Lola tried out for "American Idol" and they all sang "Hold On."
story: The early ‘90s burst onto the scene March 23 on “American Idol” when two-thirds of the group Wilson Phillips helped a relative during her audition.
The contestant, named Lola, appeared with her dad, Rob, who was holding a guitar, prompting judge Carrie Underwood to guess Lola came “from a musical family.”

After Underwood asked what song she would be singing, Lola said she had to bring in some family members to help her out. A few moments later, Lola came back in with her mom, Carnie Wilson, and her aunt, Wendy Wilson. Both women, of course, are the daughters of Beach Boys legend Brian Wilson and were in Wilson Phillips, along with Chynna Phillips.
The Wilsons’ presence threw Underwood and fellow judges Luke Bryan and Lionel Richie for a loop.
“I don’t know how to proceed right now,” the “Before He Cheats” singer said.
Lola, her parents and aunt took care of that, teaming up to sing the 1990 Wilson Phillips smash “Hold On.”
“You might know this song,” Carnie Wilson joked beforehand.

After they wrapped up, Carnie and Wendy Wilson both said they love singing as a family, but “love Lola by herself even more,” which prompted Underwood to say she would like to hear Lola sing by herself.
Her family then walked off to the side, setting the stage for Lola, 19, to audition on her own by covering Kacey Musgraves’ “Rainbow.”
Lola certainly didn’t need any family to help make an impression, either.
“You’ve got everything you need,” Richie said after she finished, while encouraging her to sing some notes longer.

“The tone and the pureness and the quality of your voice, that’s a perfect song for you. But this competition is going to require you to belt, too, and kind of let loose a little bit, fill up the room a little more and using your dynamics. But you got a really, really beautiful voice,” Bryan said.

“You have an honesty in your voice and in your presence. I want to see you own your talent and everything that you have to offer, because you have a lot to offer. And it makes me really excited to get to potentially bear witness to that,” Underwood said.
“If I’m on the show, I will push myself. That’s why I want to be on ‘American Idol.’ I want to grow,” Lola said.
The three judges didn’t need much convincing — they all voted yes, sending Lola to Hollywood for the next round.

This marks the second time this season a pop star has joined a child for an "American Idol" audition. Earlier this month, Backstreet Boys star Brian Littrell teamed up with his son, Baylee, who also made it to the next round.
Time will tell how far Lola makes it in the competition, but mom Carnie Wilson was delighted that she wanted to try out because she's growing as an artist.
"She's got something so honest and pure and lovely," she told "Entertainment Tonight."
"I could not be more excited for her," she added.

For those keeping score, "Hold On" was one of Wilson Phillips' biggest hits. It spent one week atop the Billboard Hot 100, joining "Release Me" and "You're in Love" as tracks that went to No. 1 on the chart for the group.

title: What is ‘Million Dollar Secret’? About the competition show's cast, premise and more
summary: What is Netflix’s new competition reality show "Million Dollar Secret"? About the new series including where it was filmed and the rule
story: Netflix’s new competition reality show "Million Dollar Secret" looks like the streamer’s answer to "The Traitors."
Like “The Traitors,” the series unfolds at a luxurious estate — only instead of a Scottish castle, we're in a lakeside estate in Kelowna, Canada.

And rather than rooting out a traitor, the cast of "Million Dollar Secret" has to find the single millionaire among them. The series involves manipulation, rooting out secrets and facing physical challenges, like chipping away at glaciers and being chased by a hound (yes, really).
Here’s everything you need to know about this new series.
What are the rules of 'Million Dollar Secret'?
The gist is simple: One of the 12 cast members is chosen to be a "millionaire," and everyone else tries to find out who it is.
The millionaire is (seemingly) chosen by chance. As contestants arrive at the estate, each chooses a key from host Peter Serafinowicz that goes to a different room.
Eleven of those rooms have a box that that is completely empty. One holds a million dollar prize.

Each day, contestants compete in challenges to win opportunities that will lead them closer to identifying the millionaire. At night, the contestants sit around the dinner table and choose who they think holds the prize. Whoever receives the most votes is eliminated. If successful, the pot is reshuffled to a remaining contestant. If not, the millionaire lives to see another day.

The millionaire also has their own secret agenda that they can complete to gain an advantage during eliminations. However, they must tread lightly as the other contestants are looking out for any odd behaviors that might give the millionaire away.
Who is the cast?
The cast spans all ages and occupations, and each arrive with their own competitive strategy to clinch the million.

title: Heather Tom on ‘really special’ – and historic – ‘Bold and the Beautiful’ episode that honors her mom
summary: Heather Tom talks in an interview with TODAY.com about celebrating her 35th year on daytime TV in a big way: by directing, writing and starring in a "B&B" episode.
story: Heather Tom is celebrating her 35th year on daytime TV in a big way.
The actor says she will make history March 27 when "The Bold and the Beautiful" airs an episode she wrote, directed and starred in.
“This is the first time it’s ever happened in daytime. Across any television platform, it’s only happened a handful of times for women," Tom, who plays Katie Logan on the show, tells TODAY.com.
The 49-year-old pulls triple duty in the special episode, which is all about the female stars of the show and centers on the theme of mothers and daughters.

“We have the Steffy (Jacqueline MacInnes Wood) and Taylor (Rebecca Budig) characters, and they’re kind of in a state of euphoria because they’ve pulled off something that’s very dear to them and it worked,” Tom tells TODAY.com of the mother-daughter duo. “And then we have the Brooke (Katherine Kelly Lang) and the Hope (Annika Noelle) characters who are just kind of in complete and utter turmoil. So it’s a nice juxtaposition between the two.”
Tom says she couldn't help but think of her late mother while working on the episode. She even pays tribute to her in a scene she shares with Jennifer Gareis, who plays her character's sister Donna.
“I was able to get a little bit of an homage to my mother, who passed away last year," she says, calling the experience "really special."
Tom describes her mother as a "very determined" and "very smart" woman, calling her "the reason" she's in the entertainment industry.

Directing and acting in the episode after writing it was a challenge for Tom, who made her directorial debut on "B&B" in 2016. Since then, she's directed over 30 times and written multiple episodes of the show. In addition to her work on “B&B,” Tom has also directed episodes of “The Young and the Restless,” “Dynasty” and “Good Trouble.”

"I’m so grateful and honored that Brad (Bell, the show's executive producer and head writer) would even try to do something like this because logistically, it was a feat. But everyone came together and was so supportive, and we pulled it off really seamlessly," she says.
Tom worked alongside another female director to map out all the shots and had a monitor on set to help her keep track of her own scenes while she was acting.

"It's a very emotional show. I really wanted to make sure that our scenes were blocked and really rehearsed so that the actresses who had to be so emotional knew that they could just get it in one shot," she says.
Tom is particularly thrilled that the episode is airing during Women’s History Month.
“I feel like we really need to celebrate women, especially right now, and I think that our history and our needs are something that we should highlight and celebrate,” she says.

Tom's career is certainly one that's worth celebrating. Before joining the cast of "B&B" in 2007, the actor appeared on "One Life to Live" and "All My Children." She also starred as Victoria Newman on "The Young and the Restless" alongside Joshua Morrow, who played her on-screen brother Nick Newman.

In 2024, Morrow's son Crew Morrow joined the cast of "B&B" as Tom's on-screen son, creating a "full-circle" moment for Tom, especially since her new co-star's mannerisms often remind her of his father.
"They really hit it out of the park with this one, and he’s wonderful. I’m so thrilled that he’s on the show,” she says.
Tom, who has won six Daytime Emmy Awards, says it's "kind of mind-boggling" to think that she's been on daytime TV for 35 years.
“I’m super grateful to have had a steady gig for all that time," she says.
The actor is grateful to play “such a dynamic character” and says she has a few favorite storylines from her time on the show.

“(Katie’s) heart transplant was really pivotal for the character, and I’m really glad that they have made that a part of her narrative the entire time, and not just been like, ‘Oh yeah, this happened,' and then forget about it,” she explains.
Tom also appreciates her character’s postpartum depression storyline.

“Granted, she had postpartum psychosis, so it was way extreme, but I just feel like it’s still really one of the last things that is kind of taboo to talk about. I think so many women go through it, and they feel like they can’t talk about it because somehow it’s going to mean you’re a bad mother or that you don’t love your kid. And it’s really not about that at all," she says.
Looking to the future, Tom sees "a lot of potential" for her character's continued growth, especially with her son, Will, back in the picture now.
“I’d like to see Will become a little bit more like his dad. I think that would create conflict for Katie," she says.
With her brother and sister, David and Nicholle Tom, also in the entertainment industry, it begs the question: Will the trio work together on a project in the future?
“I would love to collaborate with them on anything!” Tom says, calling her siblings “so talented.”

For now, Tom's schedule is pretty packed with her work on "B&B." Although writing, directing and starring in an episode was no small feat for the actor, she’s excited to tackle the challenge again one day.
“I certainly would welcome doing it again. But in the meantime, I am directing and still writing and still acting on the show. So I am doing all three, just not at once,” she says.

title: Benny Blanco gets rid of his unibrow with fiancée Selena Gomez's help — watch the video
summary: Benny Blanco has his eyebrows plucked as fiancée Selena Gomez watches in a new TikTok video.
story: Benny Blanco is showing off his newly groomed eyebrows in a before-and-after beauty video co-starring his supportive fiancée, Selena Gomez.
The 37-year-old music producer underwent a major tweezing session with Gomez by his side, documenting it all in a recent TikTok video.
The clip kicks off with shaggy-haired Blanco sitting in a chair and showing viewers his hairy unibrow. "OK, guys, here's the 'before,'" he says, holding the camera close to his face.
A beat later, viewers see a stylist's hands readying Blanco's eyebrows with a small brush as Gomez, 32, stands beside them. "Do it light," Gomez tells the stylist, "because I love him."
The stylist begins plucking ... and plucking ... and plucking at the scraggly hairs between Blanco's brows. "Oww!" Blanco says before the camera focuses on his red and irritated skin.
The video then shows the stylist shaping Blanco's brows with a small comb.
"What are you doing? a confused Blanco mutters under his breath.
"Are we almost done?" he says more loudly seconds later. After the stylist begins plucking his brows again, Blanco lets out a final "oww!"
The video concludes with the producer-songwriter showing off his clean new eyebrow area.
"I can't even tell the difference," he says looking at himself. "Can you guys?"
Blanco's fans couldn't help but tease him, noting that his eyebrows had, indeed, undergone a noticeable transformation.
"Respectfully, yes, we can tell the difference," one joked in the comments, while someone else added, "Looks so much better, Benny."
Many of the lovebirds' fans noted Gomez's sweet remark asking the stylist not to tweeze too much.
"Selena coming in and saying 'go light because I love him' has to be the purest thing I've heard. She does not want that man to ever change," one wrote.
Blanco and Gomez stopped by TODAY on March 21 to promote their new joint album, "I Said I Love You First," released the same day.
During their visit to Studio 1A, the couple revealed that it was Gomez who said "I love you" first in their relationship, but the moment happened while she was under anesthesia.

"When we first started dating, she had hand surgery and she was coming out of anesthesia, and she just goes, ‘I love you.’ And I said, ‘What?’ And she goes, ‘I love you.’ I was like, ‘Go back to bed,'" recalled Blanco.
Gomez tripped up and said the phrase a few more times by "mistake" while Blanco was building up the courage to say it himself, he added.

"Then I was in New York City, and I was like, ‘OK, I’m going to do it.’ I have this whole thing planned. And I was laying in bed with her and we’re about to say it and she says it before me,” he said, adding, “She steals my moment."

title: Jenna shows her dislocated finger on TODAY: ‘Now I’ve broken 3 of my 10 fingers’
summary: Jenna Bush Hager showed off the dislocated middle finger on TODAY that "just wanted to match" the one she busted on her other hand in fourth grade.
story: Jenna Bush Hager showed off the dislocated middle finger on TODAY that "just wanted to match" the one she busted on her other hand in fourth grade.

Jenna was wearing a blue splint on the middle finger on her left hand on the March 24 episode of TODAY with Jenna & Friends as she was joined by her twin sister, Barbara Pierce Bush, who served as guest co-host.
"You may notice that I'm wearing a splint, which maybe I'll have you sign during commercial break," Jenna told her sister.
Jenna told TODAY.com she suffered the injury while on vacation.
"Well, I unfortunately dislocated my middle finger," she said on TODAY.
"Yes, I received a text message about it," Barbara replied.
Jenna then shared a photo of the mangled finger, which was not for the faint of heart.
"I may put a warning on because they're going to show the picture," Jenna said ahead of the reveal.
"If you're queasy, don't look at your television for the photo," Barbara added.
"This is what happened to my finger," Jenna said to groans in the background as the picture of her gnarled finger was shown on TODAY.
Unfortunately for Jenna, she has experience with this type of injury.
"Some people may think, 'Wow that's the first time anything's ever happened to your finger,'" Jenna said.
"But they would be wrong," Barbara said.
Jenna said the health professionals examining her couldn't help but notice this wasn't her first broken finger.
"In the X-ray, the guy said, 'Seems you have a lot of hairline fractures in this finger,'" Jenna said. "And I said, 'Well now I've broken three of my 10 fingers.'"
"Things come in threes, so hopefully this is it for you," Barbara said.
Barbara remembers the last time Jenna suffered an injury to one of her middle fingers.
"In fourth grade, you were waving out the window at mom and dad and me, and you had unfortunately a strong track record of claiming you were injured," she said.
"Well, sometimes I was," Jenna said.
"That one time you were, so we didn't believe you. We thought you were playing wolf because you did like attention," Barbara responded.
The one in fourth grade was all too real, and now she has one as an adult.
"And I actually had broken my other middle finger," Jenna said about her injury as a child. "They just wanted to match."
"Perfect," Barbara added. "They're symmetrical."

title: What to know about Owen Cooper, the teenage breakout star of 'Adolescence'
